title: How to Make Nutella Filled Crepes

steps.headline: Turn on the stove to a medium heat with a small pan on that burner.
Take about a tablespoon of butter and melt it in the microwave.
You must mix the egg with the melted butter and the milk in one bowl.
Mix the flour with the sugar in a different bowl.
Once this is completed take the bowl with the milk, egg, and melted butter and add it to the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Stir all of those ingredients together to make the crepe mix.

steps.headline: After the crepe mix is prepared and the pan on the stove is ready for use; fill a spoon with the crepe mix and pour it into the pan.
Once the crepe mix is in the pan swirl it around to make it thin and as large as the pan.
Once the crepe starts to get small bubbles on the top, flip it over.
steps.description: The other side of the crepe should look cooked and not runny or soupy.

steps.headline: Then get a tablespoon of nutella and put it in the middle of the crepe.
steps.description: Try to spread out the nutella on the whole crepe.

steps.headline: Roll the crepe from one of the edges.
Then leave the crepe in the pan long enough for the nutella to melt.
Add some powder sugar on top so that the crepes look nice and presentable.

text: Turn on the stove to a medium heat with a small pan on that burner.  Take about a tablespoon of butter and melt it in the microwave.  You must mix the egg with the melted butter and the milk in one bowl.  Mix the flour with the sugar in a different bowl.  Once this is completed take the bowl with the milk, egg, and melted butter and add it to the dry ingredients. Stir all of those ingredients together to make the crepe mix. After the crepe mix is prepared and the pan on the stove is ready for use; fill a spoon with the crepe mix and pour it into the pan.  Once the crepe mix is in the pan swirl it around to make it thin and as large as the pan.  Once the crepe starts to get small bubbles on the top, flip it over. The other side of the crepe should look cooked and not runny or soupy. Then get a tablespoon of nutella and put it in the middle of the crepe. Try to spread out the nutella on the whole crepe. Roll the crepe from one of the edges.  Then leave the crepe in the pan long enough for the nutella to melt.  Add some powder sugar on top so that the crepes look nice and presentable.  Finished.
